data.title: Leaderboard
data.statement:
You need to generate leaderboard for ended clash of code.

If You don't know how clash leaderboard supposed to be sorted:
Clash leaderboard is always sorted by score (descending). If two players have same score:
  - If type is {{FASTEST}} or {{REVERSE}} the player that needed less time for solution is on top
  - If type is {{SHORTEST}} the player that has shorter solution is on top*

* simplified for purpose of this task

testCases.title: Test 1
testCases.testIn:
FASTEST
5
John 43 570 546
Anne 24 532 799
Bob 10 620 2
Ella 5 728 260
James 8 80 396

data.constraints:
1 <= [[n]] <= 10
All [[names]], [[times]] and [[length]] of codes are unique
data.stubGenerator:
read type:word(10)
read n:int
loop n read name:word(256) score:int time:int length:int
write sorted competitors
data.inputDescription:
<<line 1: >>string [[type]] of clash ({{FASTEST}}, {{REVERSE}}, {{SHORTEST}})
<<line 2: >>integer [[n]] (number of players)
<<next [[n]] lines:>> Each line includes the data for one player: [[name]], [[score]] in %, [[time]] in seconds and [[length]] of code in bytes separated by spaces. [[score]], [[time]] and [[length]] are all non-negative integers.
data.outputDescription:
You need to output players sorted as in a leaderboard.
<<[[n]] lines: >>Each line includes the data for one player: [[name]], [[score]] in %, [[time]] in seconds, [[length]] in bytes separated by spaces.

lastVersion.statementHTML:
Goal

You need to generate leaderboard for ended clash of code.

If You don't know how clash leaderboard supposed to be sorted:
Clash leaderboard is always sorted by score (descending). If two players have same score:
- If type is FASTEST or REVERSE the player that needed less time for solution is on top
- If type is SHORTEST the player that has shorter solution is on top*

* simplified for purpose of this task
Input
line 1: string type of clash (FASTEST, REVERSE, SHORTEST)
line 2: integer n (number of players)
next n lines: Each line includes the data for one player: name, score in %, time in seconds and length of code in bytes separated by spaces. score, time and length are all non-negative integers.
Output
You need to output players sorted as in a leaderboard.
n lines: Each line includes the data for one player: name, score in %, time in seconds, length in bytes separated by spaces.
Constraints
1 <= n <= 10
All names, times and length of codes are unique
Example
Input
FASTEST
5
John 43 570 546
Anne 24 532 799
Bob 10 620 2
Ella 5 728 260
James 8 80 396
Output
John 43 570 546
Anne 24 532 799
Bob 10 620 2
James 8 80 396
Ella 5 728 260
